title: Hello World
content:
Write “Hello World” in various programming language.
Python print("Hello World") C
#include <stdio.h> int main(){ printf("Hello World!\n"); return 0; } Difference between Python & C Although, there’s lots of difference, let’s begin with major stuff.
Python is an interpreted language, which runs codes line by line. However, C is a compiled language, which means it transforms codes into machine language.
Therefore, main function is required in order to inform the start of codes into the compiler.
Here’s Java Hello World code
public class Hello { public static void main(String[] args) { System.out.println("Hello World!"); } } All Java codes must be located in Class, and the name of the class has to be the same with File name.
Like C language, the main function is mandatory in Java code and must be public.
Lastly, the first parameter of the main function is an array of String( String[]).

largerThanFourNeighbors public static Dog[] largerThanFourNeighbors(Dog[] dogs) { Dog[] returnDogs = new Dog[dogs.length]; int count = 0; for(int i = 0; i < dogs.length; i++){ boolean isBigger = true; for(int j = i - 2; j <= i + 2; j++){ if(j < 0 || j >= dogs.length || j == i){ continue; } if(dogs[i].weightInPounds <= dogs[j].weightInPounds){ isBigger = false; } } if(isBigger) { returnDogs[count] = dogs[i]; count++; } } Dog[] answerDogs = new Dog[count]; for(int i = 0; i < count; i++){ answerDogs[i] = returnDogs[i]; } return answerDogs; } ë°©ëŒ€í•œ ì–‘ì˜ ì½”ë“œê°€ ì‘ì„±ë˜ì—ˆìœ¼ë©°, ê°€ë…ì„± ë˜í•œ ë–¨ì–´ì¡ŒìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤.

largerThanFourNeighbors public static boolean isBiggerThanFourNeighbors(int currentIndex, Dog[] dogs) { for (int j = currentIndex - 2; j <= currentIndex + 2; j++) { if (j < 0 || j >= dogs.length || currentIndex == j) { continue; } if (dogs[currentIndex].weightInPounds <= dogs[j].weightInPounds) { return false; } } return true; } public static Dog[] largerThanFourNeighbors(Dog[] dogs) { Dog[] returnDogs = new Dog[dogs.length]; int count = 0; for (int i = 0; i < dogs.length; i++) { if (isBiggerThanFourNeighbors(i, dogs)) { returnDogs[count] = dogs[i]; count = count + 1; } } return createNewDogs(returnDogs, count); } public static Dog[] createNewDogs(Dog[] originalDogs, int count) { Dog[] answerDogs = new Dog[count]; for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) { answerDogs[i] = originalDogs[i]; } return answerDogs; }
